validation_summary.note: These are the molecules with INCORRECT SMILES codes that need correction

corrections.name: Kobalamin (B12)
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows only a fragment (nucleoside part) with cyanide counter-ion, but B12 is a complete corrinoid complex with full structure
corrections.why_wrong: The original SMILES is highly incomplete and does not represent the full corrinoid ring system with all ligands. It only shows the nucleoside portion.

corrections.name: Cellulose
corrections.problem: The SMILES represents a single glucose unit (C6H12O6) not cellulose monomer (C6H10O5). Cellulose is a polysaccharide formed from glucose by removal of water between glycosidic bonds.
corrections.why_wrong: The formula shows repeating unit (C6H10O5)n but the SMILES shows a fully hydrated glucose (C6H12O6). Need cellobiose or disaccharide representation.

corrections.name: Koensym Q10
corrections.problem: The SMILES is severely truncated. The ubiquinone ring structure is present but the side chain is incomplete - it's missing the complete 10-isoprenyl unit.
corrections.why_wrong: The side chain in the SMILES is severely truncated. Q10 has 10 isoprenyl units (50 carbons) but only shows ~19 carbons total.

corrections.name: Hemiacetal
corrections.problem: The SMILES represents 1-methylcyclohexanol (C7H14O) not a hemiacetal. The given formula C4H8O2 would be something like methyl acetate derivative.
corrections.why_wrong: This is actually 1-methylcyclohexanol (C7H14O), not a hemiacetal. The correct structure should show the characteristic O-H and O-C bonded to same carbon.

corrections.name: Amid
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows primary amide (C2H5NO) but formula claims C3H7NO. This is likely meant to be secondary amide N,N-dimethylformamide or similar.
corrections.why_wrong: The SMILES CC(=O)N is methylformamide (acetamide, C2H5NO). The formula C3H7NO suggests N-methylacetamide which needs an additional methyl on nitrogen.

corrections.name: Karbamat
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows carbamate anion (CHN02-) but formula claims C2H5NO2. This appears to be ethyl carbamate.
corrections.why_wrong: Current SMILES only shows the carbamate group itself (HNH-CO2-). The formula C2H5NO2 suggests ethyl carbamate with ethoxy group.

corrections.name: Disulfid
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows diethyl disulfide (C4H10S2) correctly, but formula shows C4H10S2. Actually they match - likely mislabeled in file.
corrections.why_wrong: CCSSC is actually dimethyl disulfide (C2H6S2), not C4H10S2. Need CCCSCC for correct C4H10S2.

corrections.name: Sulfon
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows sulfur dioxide (SO2) but formula claims dimethyl sulfone (C2H6O2S). These are completely different.
corrections.why_wrong: O=S=O is pure SO2. The formula C2H6O2S suggests dimethyl sulfone which needs methyl groups attached to sulfur.

corrections.name: Izocyanat
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows methyl isocyanate (C2H3NO) but formula claims CHNO. This is a methylisocyanate, not isocyanate group alone.
corrections.why_wrong: The formula CHNO would be just -N=C=O without the methyl. The SMILES is correct for methyl isocyanate (C2H3NO) but formula is wrong.

corrections.name: Tiocyanat
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows methyl thiocyanate (C2H3NS) but formula claims CHNS. This structure should be SCN but shows with methyl group.
corrections.why_wrong: CHNS would be just -S-Câ‰¡N without methyl. The SMILES CSC#N is methyl thiocyanate C2H3NS.

corrections.name: Azo
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows a complex azobenzene with multiple aromatic rings and substituents but formula claims simple C12H10N2. This is likely wrong formula or wrong structure.
corrections.why_wrong: The complex SMILES shown doesn't match C12H10N2 formula. Simple azobenzene is C12H10N2. The SMILES appears to have cyanide groups and ether linkages not in formula.

corrections.name: Nitro
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows nitrite ion (NO2-) but formula claims nitrobenzene (C6H5NO2). These are completely different.
corrections.why_wrong: N(=O)[O] is nitrite. Nitrobenzene needs the benzene ring: C1=CC=C(C=C1)[N+](=O)[O-]

corrections.name: Sulfonamid
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows benzenesulfonamide (C6H7NO2S) but formula claims C6H8N2O2S with two nitrogens. This might be meant to be a different sulfonamide.
corrections.why_wrong: The SMILES has one N but formula shows two N atoms. Either formula is wrong or SMILES is missing a methyl or amino substituent.

corrections.name: Fosfonat
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows methylphosphonic acid (CH5O3P) but formula claims C2H7O3P. The formula should have 2 carbons.
corrections.why_wrong: CP(=O)(O)O is methylphosphonic (CH5O3P). To get C2H7O3P, need ethyl: CCP(=O)(O)O

corrections.name: Fosfat ester
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows dimethyl phosphate (C2H7O4P) but formula claims C3H9O4P. Need one more carbon.
corrections.why_wrong: COP(=O)(O)OC is dimethyl phosphate C2H7O4P. To get C3H9O4P, need ethyl methyl phosphate.

corrections.name: Siloksan
corrections.problem: The SMILES shows C5H16O2Si2 (hexamethyldisiloxane with OH groups) but formula claims C4H12OSi2. This is incorrect formula.
corrections.why_wrong: The SMILES C[Si](C)(O[Si](C)(C)C)O should be C5H16O2Si2 not C4H12OSi2. The formula seems wrong or missing a methyl in SMILES.

critical_issues: Kobalamin (B12): Severely incomplete SMILES - only shows nucleoside portion, missing entire corrinoid ring system
Koensym Q10: SMILES is severely truncated - side chain is incomplete
Cellulose: SMILES shows glucose not cellobiose - needs polysaccharide representation
priority_fixes: Research complete B12 structure from chemical databases
Expand Q10 side chain to full 10-unit isoprenyl chain
Use cellobiose or polysaccharide SMILES for cellulose
Verify and correct formulas for: Hemiacetal, Amid, Karbamat, Disulfid, Sulfon
recommendations.note_on_complex_molecules: Some complex molecules like vitamins and cofactors may be difficult to represent as single SMILES strings. Consider using: 1) Parent structure SMILES with comments, 2) SMILES for major active form, or 3) Link to full 3D structure.
